required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation Study of the Bioavailability of Brexpiprazole Orally Disintegrating Tablets in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, Randomized, Three-way, Crossover Trial to Evaluate the Bioavailability of Brexpiprazole (OPC-34712) Orally Disintegrating Tablets Relative to Brexpiprazole (OPC-34712) Conventional Tablets in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The ratios of the geometric means of the ODT formulation to those of the reference formulation (conventional tablet) for the bioavailability variables (Cmax, AUCt, and AUC∞ of brexpiprazole (OPC-34712)).

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate Cmax of OPC-34712 4-mg ODT formulation relative to 4-mg conventional tablet formulation

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC∞) of OPC-34712
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate AUC∞ of OPC-34712 4-mg ODT formulation relative to 4-mg conventional tablet formulation

arm_group.description: OPC-34712 (4 mg) orally disintegrating tablet is administered with water.
OPC-34712 (4 mg) orally disintegrating tablet is administered without water.
OPC-34712 (4 mg) conventional tablet is administered with water.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Capable of providing written informed consent prior to initiation of any trial-related procedures, and able, in the opinion of the investigator, to comply with all requirements of the trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant abnormality at the time of screening (eg, significant deviation from reference ranges) or in medical history that, in the opinion of investigator or sponsor may place the subject at risk or interfere with outcome variables, including drug absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion
- History of serious mental disorder
- History of drug or alcohol abuse within 2 years prior to screening
- History of any significant drug allergy
- Use of an investigational drug within 120 days prior to the first dosing of trial drug
- Use of tobacco products or daily exposure to secondhand smoke within 2 months prior to screening
- Consumption of grapefruit, grapefruit products, Seville oranges, Seville orange products, starfruit, or starfruit products within 72 hours prior to dosing
- Use of prescription, over-the-counter, or herbal medication, vitamin supplements, or St. John's Wort within 14 days prior to the first dosing of trial drug, or of antibiotics within 30 days prior to the first dosing of trial drug
- History of major surgery of the digestive tract (excluding appendectomy)
- Any subject who, in the opinion of the investigator, should not participate in the trial

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 33 subjects were screened for participation in this trial. Of the 33 subjects, 18 subjects were enrolled and randomized to one of 3 sequences, each consisting of 6 subjects. Of the 6 subjects in the Sequence 1 group, 6 subjects received a single dose of OPC-34712 orally disintegrating tablet (ODT) without water, 5 subjects received a single dose of OPC-34712 conventional tablet, and 4 subjects received a single dose of OPC-34712 ODT with water.

group.title: Sequence 1
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 1 received an ODT without water on Day 1, a conventional tablet on Day 21, and an ODT with water on Day 41.

group.title: Sequence 2
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 2 received an ODT with water on Day 1, an ODT without water on Day 21, and a conventional tablet on Day 41.

group.title: Sequence 3
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 3 received a conventional tablet on Day 1, an ODT with water on Day 21, and an ODT without water on Day 41.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Positive urine test for cotinine on Day 20 or Day 40

group.title: Sequence 1
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 1 received an ODT without water on Day 1, a conventional tablet on Day 21, and an ODT with water on Day 41.

group.title: Sequence 2
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 2 received an ODT with water on Day 1, an ODT without water on Day 21, and a conventional tablet on Day 41.

group.title: Sequence 3
group.description: Subjects randomized to Sequence 3 received a conventional tablet on Day 1, an ODT with water on Day 21, and an ODT without water on Day 41.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of OPC-34712
outcome.description: To evaluate Cmax of OPC-34712 4-mg ODT formulation relative to 4-mg conventional tablet formulation
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic analysis set consisted of subjects with all evaluable PK parameters from enrolled subjects who had evaluable plasma concentrations. No data imputation was done for missing data, ie, missing data remained missing for the analyses.

reported_events.time_frame: From the start of IMP administration throughout follow-up period (up to 22 days after the last dose of IMP)
reported_events.desc: A treatment-emergent adverse event (AE) was defined as an AE that started after start of IMP, or an AE that continued from baseline and became serious, IMP-related, or resulted in death, discontinuation, interruption or reduction of trial medication. The safety analysis dataset included all subjects that were administered at least one dose of IMP.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
